## Description {#details}

Reader for contextual iFDO profile, which comes in bitstream format.

<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we traverse the contextual profile, we typically want to visit contexts</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pertaining to a specific function. To avoid traversing the whole tree, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// want to keep a per-function list - which will be in preorder - of that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function&#39;s contexts. This happens in PGOContextualProfile. For memory use</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// efficiency, we want to make PGOCtxProfContext an intrusive double-linked list</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// node. We need to handle the cases where PGOCtxProfContext nodes are moved and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// deleted: in both cases, we need to update the index (==list). We can do that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// directly from the node in the list, without knowing who the &quot;parent&quot; of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// list is. That makes the ADT ilist overkill here. Finally, IndexNode is meant</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be an implementation detail of PGOCtxProfContext, and the only reason it&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// factored out is to avoid implementing move semantics for all its members.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/internal/indexnode"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">IndexNode &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This class&#39; members are intentionally private - it&#39;s a convenience</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implementation detail.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A node (context) in the loaded contextual profile, suitable for mutation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// during IPO passes. We generally expect a fraction of counters and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// callsites to be populated. We continue to model counters as vectors, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// callsites are modeled as a map of a map. The expectation is that, typically,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// there is a small number of indirect targets (usually, 1 for direct calls);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// but potentially a large number of callsites, and, as inlining progresses,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the callsite count of a caller will grow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pgoctxprofcontext"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">PGOCtxProfContext final : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/internal/indexnode">internal::IndexNode</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pgoctxprofcontext/#afe49915d2374d86f45b65d4bbc8f7208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pgoctxprofcontext/#afe49915d2374d86f45b65d4bbc8f7208">CallTargetMapTy</a> = std::map&lt;GlobalValue::GUID, PGOCtxProfContext&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pgoctxprofcontext/#a9cb043dbc57db0649037709a60529e16"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pgoctxprofcontext/#a9cb043dbc57db0649037709a60529e16">CallsiteMapTy</a> = std::map&lt;uint32&#95;t, CallTargetMapTy&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
